title: Putin threatens Kyiv decision-makers after striking energy grid
content: Russia says it is selecting Ukrainian targets and may hit government offices in the capital.
summary: Russia says it is selecting Ukrainian targets and may hit government offices in the capital.

title: Sweden asks China to co-operate over severed cables
content: Two cables in the Baltic Sea linking Sweden to Lithuania, and Finland to Germany, were damaged.
summary: Two cables in the Baltic Sea linking Sweden to Lithuania, and Finland to Germany, were damaged.

title: Israel building new military dividing line across Gaza, satellite images suggest
content: Satellite images show the IDF has destroyed hundreds of buildings in north Gaza as it creates the divide.
summary: Satellite images show the IDF has destroyed hundreds of buildings in north Gaza as it creates the divide.

title: Families return to destruction in southern Lebanon
content: Displaced Lebanese are trying to get to their homes after a ceasefire came into force.
summary: Displaced Lebanese are trying to get to their homes after a ceasefire came into force.

title: Syria rebels launch major offensive in north-west and gain territory
content: The rebels have reportedly taken several towns and villages in Aleppo and Idlib provinces since Wednesday.
summary: The rebels have reportedly taken several towns and villages in Aleppo and Idlib provinces since Wednesday.

title: Voters to take to the polls in Irish general election
content: Polling stations will be open in the Republic of Ireland between 07:00 and 22:00 local time on Friday.
summary: Polling stations will be open in the Republic of Ireland between 07:00 and 22:00 local time on Friday.

title: Conor McGregor waxwork removed from museum
content: The National Wax Museum Plus says it removed the figure two weeks ago in light of his civil trial.
summary: The National Wax Museum Plus says it removed the figure two weeks ago in light of his civil trial.

title: Zimbabwe parliament hit by power cut during budget speech
content: Zimbabwe has faced daily 12-hour power cuts due to a drought affecting power supply at the Kariba Dam.
summary: Zimbabwe has faced daily 12-hour power cuts due to a drought affecting power supply at the Kariba Dam.

title: Romania orders election recount after TikTok bias claims
content: TikTok denies it gave preferential treatment to any candidate in Romania's presidential election.
summary: TikTok denies it gave preferential treatment to any candidate in Romania's presidential election.

title: Australia approves social media ban on under-16s
content: The ban aims to reduce "harms" on children and will take at least a year to implement, the PM says.
summary: The ban aims to reduce "harms" on children and will take at least a year to implement, the PM says.

title: At least 113 people missing after Uganda landslide - police
content: At least 15 bodies have been found but officials fear the true number of dead is much higher.
summary: At least 15 bodies have been found but officials fear the true number of dead is much higher.

title: Paris's Gothic jewel Notre-Dame to reopen five years after fire
content: The rescued, renovated and refurbished cathedral will offer visitors what promises to be a breathtaking visual treat.
summary: The rescued, renovated and refurbished cathedral will offer visitors what promises to be a breathtaking visual treat.

title: Mark Zuckerberg dines with Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago
content: Relations appear to have improved markedly from Trump's threat earlier this year to throw the Meta boss in jail.
summary: Relations appear to have improved markedly from Trump's threat earlier this year to throw the Meta boss in jail.

title: Colombian navy intercepts narco-subs taking new route to Australia
content: A semi-submersible packed full of cocaine is the latest of a number to be seized in the Pacific Ocean.
summary: A semi-submersible packed full of cocaine is the latest of a number to be seized in the Pacific Ocean.

title: 'Arctic' blast in US after Thanksgiving travellers fill airports
content: Severe conditions are expected in northern and eastern areas during the country's busiest travel period.
summary: Severe conditions are expected in northern and eastern areas during the country's busiest travel period.

title: Watch: Students safe after school bus catches fire in Australia
content: The driver and all students were safely evacuated after the bus caught fire during the morning school run.
summary: The driver and all students were safely evacuated after the bus caught fire during the morning school run.

title: Beirut resident returning home: 'Everything was gone'
content: 25 year-old Rayane Salman describes how she and her parents lost their home and possessions in an Israeli air strike.
summary: 25 year-old Rayane Salman describes how she and her parents lost their home and possessions in an Israeli air strike.

title: BBC sees destruction in southern Beirut suburb
content: BBC Arabic’s Rami Ruhayem went to Dahieh, in southern Beirut, to see the damage caused by Israel's attacks.
summary: BBC Arabic’s Rami Ruhayem went to Dahieh, in southern Beirut, to see the damage caused by Israel's attacks.

title: BBC on the ground as people return to southern Lebanon
content: The BBC's Middle East correspondent, Hugo Bachega, is at the main highway between Beirut and the south as people start to return to their homes.
summary: The BBC's Middle East correspondent, Hugo Bachega, is at the main highway between Beirut and the south as people start to return to their homes.

title: People in Israel and Lebanon react to ceasefire deal
content: People in Tel Aviv and Beirut shared feelings of relief and doubt as they reacted to the news.
summary: People in Tel Aviv and Beirut shared feelings of relief and doubt as they reacted to the news.

title: Astronauts unbox Thanksgiving meal aboard ISS
content: "We're thankful for zero gravity" says stranded astronaut Barry "Butch" Wilmore.
summary: "We're thankful for zero gravity" says stranded astronaut Barry "Butch" Wilmore.

title: Watch: Netanyahu explains why Israel agreed ceasefire deal
content: His announcement comes after more than a year of conflict between Israeli and Hezbollah forces.
summary: His announcement comes after more than a year of conflict between Israeli and Hezbollah forces.

title: Aftermath of Israeli strikes on Beirut neighbourhoods
content: Israel launches extensive air strikes on Beirut's southern suburbs after its military issued evacuation orders in the area.
summary: Israel launches extensive air strikes on Beirut's southern suburbs after its military issued evacuation orders in the area.

title: Drone footage shows huge fire engulfing Manila shanty town
content: Around 1,000 houses were destroyed in the blaze, officials say, months after a similar incident in the Philippine capital.
summary: Around 1,000 houses were destroyed in the blaze, officials say, months after a similar incident in the Philippine capital.

title: Standing ovation as long awaited COP29 finance deal agreed
content: The new deal offers $300bn (about £240) a year to developing nations by 2035.
summary: The new deal offers $300bn (about £240) a year to developing nations by 2035.

title: Canada’s oil patch rattled by Trump's tariff plan
content: The proposed tariffs, if applied to oil and gas, could hammer Canada's economy and hike prices at the pump for Americans, analysts say.
summary: The proposed tariffs, if applied to oil and gas, could hammer Canada's economy and hike prices at the pump for Americans, analysts say.

title: A fatal car crash in India sparks concerns over Google Maps
content: Three men allegedly using Google Maps for directions died after their car fell off an unfinished bridge.
summary: Three men allegedly using Google Maps for directions died after their car fell off an unfinished bridge.

title: Death threats and division: A political feud takes a dramatic turn
content: The powerful Marcos-Duterte alliance has spectacularly unravelled in the Philippines.
summary: The powerful Marcos-Duterte alliance has spectacularly unravelled in the Philippines.

title: Ceasefire largely holds but Israelis near Lebanon border have their doubts
content: Some people say the ceasefire with Hezbollah is a mistake, even a “surrender”.

title: Jeremy Bowen: The Lebanon ceasefire is a respite, not a solution for the Middle East
